intro: Melandrium affine var. brachycalyx, commonly known as the short-calyx catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds. It is a short-lived perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
